intro: Convolvulus tricolor var. maroccanus, commonly known as the Moroccan tri-color morning glory, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and vibrant, three-colored flowers that range from purple to pink and white. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, often growing as a climbing or trailing plant. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
